meanings.definition: Below the usual or required standard in quality or value.
meanings.sent2: The inspector found the substandard materials unacceptable.
meanings.sent3: The substandard cake was so bad, even the dog wouldn't eat it.
meanings.sent4: Her substandard performance in the play left the audience disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The substandard service at the restaurant made customers never want to return.

meanings.sent1: The substandard work did not pass the quality check.
meanings.sent2: The substandard safety measures put the workers at risk.
meanings.sent3: His substandard attempt at a joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The substandard effort in training led to poor results on the field.
meanings.sent5: The substandard ingredients in the recipe ruined the entire dish.
